## InvViewProjMatrixNode class

Inverse view-projection matrix input node

**Signature:**

```typescript
declare class InvViewProjMatrixNode extends BaseGraphNode 
```
**Extends:** [BaseGraphNode](doc/markdown/./scene.basegraphnode.md)

## Remarks

Provides the inverse of the view-projection matrix (clip space to world space transformation). This matrix transforms coordinates from normalized device coordinates (NDC) back to world space.

Equivalent to: inverse(projectionMatrix \* viewMatrix)

Used for: - Screen-space to world-space reconstruction - Deferred rendering world position reconstruction - Picking and ray casting from screen coordinates - Screen-space effects needing world position

Output: - Output 1: 4x4 inverse view-projection matrix (mat4)

## Example


```typescript
const invViewProjMatrix = new InvViewProjMatrixNode();
const screenPos = new ScreenPositionNode();

// Reconstruct world position from screen coordinates
const transform = new TransformNode();
transform.connectInput(1, screenPos, 1);
transform.connectInput(2, invViewProjMatrix, 1);
```
